content.description: Start on low jugs of crack and follow crack all the way to lip and sloper rail, and make sketchy topout
Climb up jugs they look kinda like teeth
content.location: Warm up line on obvious jugs under Fifty prow

content.description: Start with good right hand crystal a little above eye level and pick one of the barely there left hand nubs. Get good feet to fire up to a sharp left hand crimp. Set higher feet and crank through to a right hand crimp above the lip. Work through and mantel up. Sharp but fun
content.protection: Pads and spotter for rock behind fall
content.location: Clean streak of rock to the left of Knife Party slab in the corridor made by the small boulder behind you.

content.description: Start on two lowest pebbles, and work your way up the slab, without using the crack. Finish on the jug at the top and mantel. Very possibly best slab in Richmond
content.location: Large obvious slab facing the back of the Little Brother

content.description: Same start as Fifty Project but instead of pulling straight up onto slab, work over to a match on the arete and pull around to top out onto Nothing Special

A traverse extension to Little Feat. Start at the right side of the decent crack and work through crimps and low feet to finish as per Little Feat. Can also be used as an extension for Brother Mantel but only bumps that to a V3.
content.location: Descent slab of the Big Brother boulder

content.description:
Unsent sit start of Cheese Grater.  Two distinct betas, both of which are promising.  One beta mimics the stand start; use the monster left hand undercling and put your right hand where your right foot would go for the stand start.  Then levitate so you can swing your right foot up to where your hand is.  Next step: profit.

 Other option is to keep your hands completely in the "chute" of Cheese Grater.  Still use the heel hook where your right foot would be for the stand start.  Again levitate to get your hand up higher in the chute, then profit.
Start matched on obvious rail. Use nubs, slopers, and a good sidepull to haul yourself up.
content.location: Low rail and slab on backside of Brother boulder. To the right of large decent crack and to the left of Little Feat.

content.description: Start with left hand on big sidepull and a right hand mantel. Get established on the slab and friction your way up.
content.location: Mossy slab right of Fifty start

content.description: Sit start to Fifty Project. Likely V-Hard
Proudest line on the boulder.  Stand start with left hand on arete and right hand on sloper sidepull. Crank up onto the slab and top out straight up using quartz crystals.
content.location: Prow on backside of Big Brother

content.description: Larger, slightly mossy boulder. Warm ups, hard mantels, crimp lines and friction slabs.
